title: Aaron Paul comes together with the cast of Breaking Bad for the El Camino premiere
text:
The Breaking Bad cast has reunited for the premiere of Netflix's El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie, six years after the show's finale.

Aaron Paul was joined by Bryan Cranston and the rest of the cast on the red carpet in Los Angeles Monday to watch the film ahead of its October 11 release.

Audiences last saw Paul's character Jesse Pinkman in the Breaking Bad series finale, when he was speeding off in a hysterical frenzy in that El Camino after Cranston's Walter White saved him from his captors who had enslaved him to produce mass amounts of methamphetamine.

And it now looks like White may return on screen for the film to the joy of Breaking Bad fans everywhere.

The Breaking Bad cast reunited for the premiere of Netflix's El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie, six years after the show's finale

Aaron Paul was joined by Bryan Cranston and the rest of the cast on the red carpet in Los Angeles Monday to watch the film ahead of its October 11 release

Aaron Paul will be reprising his role as Jesse Pinkman in the film while fans hope they'll see Bryan Cranston as Walter White

After White rigged a remote-control machine that wiped out the captors, the two partners in crime stared at each other in a tense standoff the resulted in Pinkman refusing White's request for him to kill him.

They eventually parted ways with one last nod of respect to one another.

Breaking Bad, the series, ran from 2008 to 2013 and garnered widespread acclaim from both fans and critics around the world.

It followed White, a terminally ill high school chemistry teacher as he created a meth empire with Pinkman, his former inept student.

Series creator, writer and executive producer Vince Gilligan returned to write and direct this two-hour film.

He also co-created the prequel series Better Call Saul, which has run for four seasons from 2015 to the present day. It has been renewed for a fifth season and is slated to premiere in 2020.

Betsy Brandt (left) attends the Premiere of Netflix's 'El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie' at Regency Village Theatre on October 07, 2019. She played Marie Schrader (right) on the show

RJ Mitte looked dapper at the premiere. He played Walter White, Jr. for all five seasons of Breaking Bad

Dean Norris had fun on the carpet. He played Hank Shrader on the hit show for all five seasons

Giancarlo Esposito made an appearance on the red carpet. He played Gustavo 'Gus' Fring for 26 episodes

Cranston all but confirmed the movie while appearing on The Dan Patrick Show earlier this year.

Revealing that he'd 'absolutely' appear in spin-off he explained: 'It's a great story and there are a lot of people who felt that they wanted to see some kind of completion to some of these storylines that were left open [in the series finale].

'This idea, from what I'm told, gets into those — at least a couple of the character show were not completed, as far as their journey.'

Breaking Bad's hardcore fans have been eagerly anticipating more content from the Albuquerque-based drama.

And lucky for them Jesse Pinkman is also ready.

Jesse Plemons was spotted at the premiere. He played Todd for 13 episodes

Charles Baker showed up to Monday night's premiere. He played Skinny Pete for 15 episodes

Matty Jones on the red carpet. He starred as Badger in Breaking Bad

Aaron Paul was featured heavily in the first full trailer released for the upcoming film.

The two-minute clip shows Jesse on the run from law enforcement and climaxes at the end when he runs into a mystery man.

The two men appear to be having a showdown as the camera focuses on the shadowy figure's hand next to a holstered knife.

It dramatically focuses in on Jesse before a voice - which many viewers are already speculating is Walter White (Bryan Cranston) - could be heard querying: 'You ready?'

El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie premieres on Netflix October 11.
description: The Breaking Bad cast reunited for the premiere of Netflix's El Camino: A Breaking Bad Movie, six years after the show's finale.
